page.title: 01Local History.
page.content: {Downton is a small village six miles {south of Salisbury. It got is name {from the Anglo-Saxons who called it {Dunton, the village by the hill. {Excavations have revealed a Roman {villa near Moot Lane, which was built {about 300 A.D. The Saxon Moot is one {of the interesting parts of Downton {with its legends of ghosts that are {supposed to haunt it at night. The {Borough is the main street in Downton {and there are several attractive {cottages and a cross. Downton had many {cottage industuries in the Victorian {period , the main ones were basket and {lace making which Downton was famous {for. Nowadays there is a tannery. {Every May bank holiday weekend Downton {welcomes the Cuckoo. To celebrate this {event a Cuckoo Fair is held.
